p: Two specimens containing HSV1 were isolated from the patients. A study estimated the incidence rates of HSV eye disease ranged from approximately four to 13 new cases per 100,000 population. 24 Chlamydia is the most frequent identifiable cause of neonatal conjunctivitis in many countries, and its incidence is still on the rise on an annual basis. 9 Human HSV3, also known as VZV, is a main pediatric infection that presents with a vesicular rash referred to as chickenpox. 25 Despite the fact that no cases of C. trachomatis or VZV were found in this study on PCR, these two pathogens are considered the main agents of causing infection in infants.
